page.title: 01 Gazetteer
page.content: Our project covers most of Awsworth, Kimberley, Nuthall, Strelley and Cossall. Much of the area is farmland, especially round Babbington, Strelley and Cossall. However, there are some industries in one or two areas. At Kimberley, there is a brewery and a timber merchants while at Awsworth there is a concrete firm and a new garden centre. In the north west part of the area the river Erewash and the Nottingham Canal can be seen near the iron viaduct and a big coal plant has just been built nearby. The M1 motorway crosses the south east of the area and is easily linked to Awsworth, Nuthall and Kimberley by good roads. Between Nuthall and the motorway there is Temple Lake and near Strelley is the wooded area of Spring Wood.
